Package io.smint.clapi.consumer.integration.core.factory.impl

Class DefaultSyncTargetFactory

java.lang.Object
io.smint.clapi.consumer.integration.core.factory.impl.DefaultSyncTargetFactory
All Implemented Interfaces:
ISyncTargetFactory
@Singleton public class DefaultSyncTargetFactory extends Object implements ISyncTargetFactory
A factory to hold all synchronization target specific implementation classes as pre-created instances.

This class can be used with Java dependency injection to provide the required classes. Any dependency injection available in the implementation application is sufficient. Just add proper configuration to your DI. Nevertheless an instance does not need to be created utilizing dependency injection. It can be used as is and all necessary instances passed to the constructor.

Example without any dependency injection

Even without any dependency injection available, it is easy to create an instance holding all necessary pre-created instances. The instance for ISyncTarget is created by a lambda function to ensure a new instance is created all the time. 

 final ISyncTargetFactory syncFactory = new DefaultSyncTargetFactory()
     .setSettingsProvider(() -> settings)
     .setAuthTokenStorage(new MyAuthTokenStorage())
     .setJobDataStorage(new MyJobStorageHandler())
     .setDataFactory(new MySyncTargetDataFactory())
     .setSyncTargetProvider(() -> new MySyncTarget())
  );

  • Constructor Details

    • DefaultSyncTargetFactory

      public DefaultSyncTargetFactory()

    • DefaultSyncTargetFactory

      @Inject public DefaultSyncTargetFactory(IAuthTokenStorage authTokenProvider, Provider<ISettingsModel> settings, ISyncTargetDataFactory dataFactory, Provider<ISyncTarget> syncTargetProvider, ISyncJobDataStorage syncJobDataStorage)
      create a new sync factory with pre-created values.
      Parameters:
      authTokenProvider - already created and available authentication token provider
      settings - already available settings provider
      dataFactory - the factory for sync target data instances
      syncTargetProvider - a sync target provider
      syncJobDataStorage - a storage to read from and write job data to

  • Method Details

    • createSyncTarget

      public ISyncTarget createSyncTarget()
      Creates an instance of the synchronization target instance.

      Since the synchronization target is a heavy class with a lot of cache data, it seems better to create a new instance on each call. However, the implementor of the sync target need to decide whether it is necessary to create a new instance on each call or not. At the moment the default implementation of ISyncJob, which is DefaultSyncJob, reuses the target for all synchronization processes as long as the job is being scheduled. As soon as the job is being rescheduled, a new synchronization target will be created.

      Specified by:
      createSyncTarget in interface ISyncTargetFactory
      Returns:
      returns a new sync target on each call.

    • getSettings

      public ISettingsModel getSettings()
      Return the current settings for the synchronization process, which may have changed in the meantime.

      This function is called very, very often. So please use some form of caching to check, whether the data really have changed from one call to another. Although the settings hardly change, they might do.

      Specified by:
      getSettings in interface ISyncTargetFactory
      Returns:
      returns the currently valid settings on each request.

    • getAuthTokenStorage

      public IAuthTokenStorage getAuthTokenStorage()
      Creates a token storage to deliver the settings for authentication to the Smint.IO RESTful API.
      Specified by:
      getAuthTokenStorage in interface ISyncTargetFactory
      Returns:
      the same authentication token storage on each request but must not return null.

    • getJobDataStorage

      public ISyncJobDataStorage getJobDataStorage()
      Description copied from interface: ISyncTargetFactory
      Creates a job data storage to make job data available for next run.

      If this function returns null, then an in-memory storage is used as default. The job data will be available for different runs but will automatically removed from memory, once the sync jobs are stopped and terminated. Nevertheless, it should be sufficient for most cases.

      Specified by:
      getJobDataStorage in interface ISyncTargetFactory
      Returns:
      the same storage on each request or null.

    • getTargetDataFactory

      public ISyncTargetDataFactory getTargetDataFactory()
      Description copied from interface: ISyncTargetFactory
      Get the factory to create sync target (DAM) specific data instances.
      Specified by:
      getTargetDataFactory in interface ISyncTargetFactory
      Returns:
      a valid factory instance and must not return null
